revised_title: A Case Study of Conjoined Twins
tldr: This article presents a case study of conjoined twins, born to a woman in Lancaster County. The twins are both female, with one being a healthy-looking girl while the other is imperfect and attached to the first child by cartilaginous substance. The article describes the physical characteristics and medical observations of the twins, including their lack of head, neck, and respiration, as well as their limbs and skeletal abnormalities.
